DG.SpecialTraining.Dialog.Title: Create/Edit Special Training
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.HP: Hit Points (HP) indicate physical health, a character becomes unconsious at 2 HP, and dies at 0 HP.
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.WP: Willpower Points (WP) indicate mental fortitude and drive. Agents require Willpower Points to keep going despite exhaustion or mentally taxing situations. See Page 47 of the Agent's Handbook for more detail.
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.SAN: Sanity Points (SAN) indicate a connection with humanity and reality as most people perceive it. Click to roll a SAN test
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.str: See Page 19 of the Agent's Handbook - Strength
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.con: See Page 19 of the Agent's Handbook - Constitution
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.dex: See Page 19 of the Agent's Handbook - Dexterity
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.int: See Page 19 of the Agent's Handbook - Intelligence
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.pow: See Page 19 of the Agent's Handbook - Power
DG.Attributes.Tooltip.cha: See Page 19 of the Agent's Handbook - Charisma

DG.About.OnlineHelpTooltip: Launch browser with online GitHub help.
DG.About.OnlineBugTracker: Questions, Bug Reports or Feature Requests (ONLINE)
DG.About.OnlineBugTrackerTooltip: Launch browser with GitHub issue tracker.
DG.Physical.FirstAidLabel: First Aid Has Already Been Attempted:
DG.Mental.Tooltip.BreakingPoint: The Breaking Point is the exact point of SAN at which your Agent has been worn down enough by trauma to develop a new, long-term mental disorder. If SAN reaches that point or below, subtract your Agent’s POW from the new SAN. That’s your Agent’s new Breaking Point.
DG.Mental.SanityLossIncidentsLabel: Incidents of SAN Loss Without Going Insane
DG.Gear.Name: Name
DG.Bonds.Name: Name
DG.Tooltip.MaximumHP: Maximum health is the average of STR + CON, rounded UP.
DG.Tooltip.MaximumWP: Maximum WP is equal to POW.
DG.Tooltip.CurrentSanityPartOne: Current sanity, current breaking point is
DG.Tooltip.CurrentSanityPartTwo: , click the SAN label above to roll a sanity check.
DG.Tooltip.MaximumSanity: Maximum sanity is equal to 99 - the Unnatural skill.
DG.Tooltip.SkillLabel: Click to roll a skill check.
DG.Tooltip.CannotRollSkillLabel: A skill at 0% cannot be used.  See page 28 of the Agent's Handbook.
DG.Tooltip.SkillFailCheckbox: After failing a test on this skill (if proficiency is at least 1%), check this box. At the end of the session, add 1D4 percentage points to the skill and uncheck the box. Does not apply to the Unnatural or Ritual skill.  See Page 29 of the Agent's Handbook.
DG.Tooltip.DistinguishingFeature: Distinguishing Feature (fill out if score is 13 or higher, or 8 or lower).
DG.Tooltip.x5AttributeLabel: Click to roll a x5 check.
DG.Tooltip.FirstAidAttempted: Once an agent receives first aid, they cannot benefit from it again until they receive further damage from a different source.
DG.Tooltip.AdaptedToViolence: Being adapted to violence means your Agent’s empathy suffers as they come to view violence as nothing but another tool to be wielded. Agent permanently loses 1D6 CHA and the same amount from each of their Bonds.
DG.Tooltip.AdaptedToHelplessness: Being adapted to helplessness means your Agent’s personal drive suffers as they pull back from the world around them. As soon as your Agent becomes adapted to helplessness, agent permanently loses 1D6 POW.
DG.Tooltip.ToggleEquippedState: Click to toggle whether this item is equipped or not.
DG.Tooltip.Exhaustion: An Agent who works too long or faces extreme danger and injury without resting becomes exhausted. When this comes into play is up to the Handler, but a good rule of thumb is that going a night without sleep or refusing to rest after losing SAN or Hit Points leads to exhaustion.
DG.ItemWindow.Bonds.ScoreTooltip: A higher score represents a stronger relationship between the agent and the bond.
DG.ItemWindow.Motivations.DisorderNameTo: A disorder replaces a motivation after hitting a break point.
DG.ItemWindow.Motivations.IsDisorderTool: Check this if adding a disorder, or if an existing motivation has been lost due to gaining a disorder.
DG.ItemWindow.Motivations.DisorderHasBee: A critical success on a therapy luck roll can 'cure' a disorder.  It may return the next time a breaking point is hit however. See Pages 78-79 of the Agent's Handbook - Therapy.
DG.ItemWindow.Weapons.LethalityTooltip: A lethal weapon has a chance to instantly kill a target.  Roll a D100 instead of damage die.  If it is not lethal, damage is dealt instead as if the result was a 2d10 roll, with a '00' on the first d10 equaling a 10.
DG.ItemWindow.Weapons.IsLethalityTooltip: Check this if the weapon has a lethality % associated with it.
DG.ModifySkillRollDialogue.Title: Modify Roll
DG.ModifySkillRollDialogue.ModifierToolt: Give a positive or negative modifier here to add/subtract from the target for the skill check.
DG.ModifyDamageRollDialogue.OuterModifie: Use this field to modify the outer part of the formula, such as to double the result.
DG.ModifyDamageRollDialogue.InnerModifie: Use this field to add a flat modifier such as '+1' or another dice term such as '+1d4'.
DG.Tooltip.BreakPoint: The current breaking point, reset when current sanity falls to or below this value.  The starting breaking point is SAN - POW.
DG.Tooltip.BreakPointReset: Reset breaking point to be current SAN - WP.
DG.UnnaturalSheet.ShortDescriptionFallba: Description of creature or creature type
DG.Generic.CheckDamagedBondsBoxUntilNext: Check a damaged Bond's box until the next Home Scene ends.
DG.Tomes.Name: Name
DG.Ritual.Name: Name
DG.Tome.Name: Name
DG.Settings.charactersheet.name: Character Sheet Style
DG.Settings.charactersheet.hint: Choose how actor sheets should be styled. 'Program' is a more modern government style, where 'Cowboy/Outlaw' is an older, grittier looking typewriter style.
DG.Settings.sortskills.name: Sort Skills By Column?
DG.Settings.sortskills.hint: Checked sorts by column. Unchecked sorts by row.
DG.Settings.keepSanityPrivate.name: Keep Sanity Private
DG.Settings.keepSanityPrivate.hint: Hide sanity from players on both character sheet and rolls.
DG.Settings.skillImprovementFormula.name: Default Skill Improvement Roll
DG.Settings.skillImprovementFormula.hint: Default 1d4. There have been multiple errata on this, choose which fits best for the pace of your game.
DG.Settings.alwaysShowHypergeometrySecti: Always Show Hypergeometry Section for Players
Always show Hypergeometry item section for players, even if they don't have any items of that type.
DG.Settings.showImpossibleLandscapesCont: Show Impossible Landscapes-specific fields from character sheets.
DG.Settings.skillFailure.name: Auto-mark Skill Failure
DG.Settings.skillFailure.hint: Activate this setting to always mark a failure checkbox upon failing a skill. This also enables an undo function in the chat card.
DG.SettingsMenu.automation.name: Automation Menu
DG.SettingsMenu.automation.label: Automation Menu

DG.SettingsMenu.handler.label: Handler Settings
